title: What are the advantages of knowing the different function and philosophical perspective on art? - Quora

response.answer_text: The more we know, the more we see, that’s as philosophy - love for wisdom - may be, life as good enough to death. Without birth… nobody can die. So there’s that rule. Art… apart… we see from the shadows… light. From silence… peace… or fear. From balance, niece, and here. Taught freedom, children fly, teach them prisons, and they will die. So… life, art itself, is not a ‘passing by’, entertaining waiting for the ‘Royal’ Flight, but directing our minds and souls to there… the beginning, not the cannon, we’re not bullets, but the one holding the lighter. We know birds fly, we know eggs make as frogs as chickens, and we, humans, eat both, and also the fishes. God is not a cook, and we are not food. Art … spreads that, visions to all perspectives around, as a match can blow up a bomb. Art frees our minds, but not only, so vegetables, and molecules, as snow and atoms, grow better with music, harmonically produced, reproduced by and among us, human. As a match can explode a bomb, art is the poison of the arrow, as if expanding the snake's mouth to take a single bite ... on the human being who feels it. Art is a feeling, expressed only among and from humans… perhaps to say ‘no’, to contest, Nature, as perfection.

Enjoyment and understanding. Knowing why artists all over one country made art one way and why artists in another time and place made very different art is fascinating and enriches the experience of looking at art. People who love sports know the functions and purposes of the different aspects of the sport. People who love science know how and why and when of thousands of details of biology or physics or entomology etc. Arts are the unique expressions of entire civilizations across all of the known areas and times that people created symbols of what they knew and felt. Art is the way people express and understand meaning of symbolic objectification of all aspects of reality and imagination.
